title: Level 3 Number Practice Test
description: Test your skills with numbers to 10,000, multiplication and division facts, and fractions!

questions.question: What is the value of the digit 6 in 6,305?
questions.explanation: The digit 6 is in the thousands place. Its value is $6 \times 1000 = 6000$.

questions.question: Which number is the largest? $4,892$ or $4,928$ or $4,829$?
questions.explanation: All have 4 thousands. Compare hundreds: 892 has 8, 928 has 9, 829 has 8. Since $9 > 8$, $4928$ is the largest.

questions.question: What is $4 \times 7$?
questions.explanation: From the 4 times table: $4 \times 7 = 28$. You can also think: $4 \times 7$ is double $2 \times 7 = 14$, and $14 \times 2 = 28$.

questions.question: What is $45 \div 5$?
questions.explanation: Think: $5 \times \;? = 45$. From the 5 times table: $5 \times 9 = 45$. So $45 \div 5 = 9$.

questions.question: What is $\frac{1}{4}$ of 20?
questions.explanation: To find $\frac{1}{4}$ of 20, divide by 4: $20 \div 4 = 5$. One quarter of 20 is 5.

questions.question: A cake is cut into 6 equal slices. Tom eats 2 slices. What fraction of the cake is left?
questions.explanation: The cake has 6 slices. Tom ate 2, so $6 - 2 = 4$ slices are left. The fraction left is $\frac{4}{6}$ (four sixths).

questions.question: What is $3 \times 9$?
questions.explanation: From the 3 times table: $3 \times 9 = 27$. Check: $2 + 7 = 9$ (a multiple of 3) âœ“

questions.question: What is $36 \div 4$?
questions.explanation: Think: $4 \times \;? = 36$. From the 4 times table: $4 \times 9 = 36$. So $36 \div 4 = 9$.

questions.question: Round 7,450 to the nearest 1,000.
questions.explanation: Look at the hundreds digit: 4. Since $4 < 5$, round down. $7450 \approx 7000$.
